results.title: The Selfish giant
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Reiner Film, Murray Shostak and Peter Sander
results.brief_description: Animated interpretation of Oscar Wilde’s allegory about selfishness, sharing and love. A beautiful garden is beset by perpetual winter after a greedy giant forbids children to play there. Then he is compelled to help a mysterious child who enters the garden and spring comes. At his life’s end the giant is led to another garden by this child.

results.title: The Segovia Master Class in Spain
results.creator_credit: National Educational Television and Nathan Kroll
results.brief_description: Part of the “Library of Master Performers” series. Instructional video featuring one of the world’s finest classical Spanish guitarists, Andres Segovia, as he performs and teaches students at the Santiago de Compostela in Spain. First he works with Aldo Minella (from Italy) on the Concerto in D for guitar, first movement by M. Castelnuovo-Tedesco and then with Luis Rodrigo (from Spain) with the piece Tarantella also by M. Castelnuovo-Tedesco.

results.title: The Seekers: land of fury
results.creator_credit: Fanfare Films, George H. Brown and Ken Annakin
results.brief_description: This film is set in New Zealand’s early pioneering days of the 1820’s. It was a time when British settlers had to come to terms with their strange new environment and its Maori inhabitants. A group of British pioneers arrive in New Zealand with the hope for a new life down under. Philip Wayne (Jack Hawkins) and his new wife Marion (Glynis Johns), are two such pioneers. Against adverse factors, such as an earthquake, they manage to build a new settlement and garner support from the local Maori neighbours. Tensions rise when Philip becomes captivated by the wife of Chief Hongi Tepe (Inia Te Wiata), and the Maori tribes turn against the settlement in retaliation for their interracial relationship.

results.title: The Seed plants: diversity in adaptation
results.brief_description: By comparing the gymnosperms and angiosperms to more primitive plants and to each other, we learn why they are so successfully adapted to various land environments. Shows the distinguishing characteristics of these seed plants, their methods of reproductioon and why they are the most numerous of the plants on earth.

results.title: The Sediment problem
results.creator_credit: University of Strathclyde and Gordon Thomas
results.brief_description: An examination of the detrimental depletion of soil resources from the land by natural means and by man’s intervention. Shot at a number of locations in the Scottish Highlands and the Clyde Valley. Intended for students of civil engineering.

results.title: The Security Council
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Office of Public Information and V.R. Sarma
results.brief_description: Explains the Council’s powers, membership and procedure in dealing with international crises. Describes its action in Indonesia, Israel, Korea and the Congo. Emphasises its primary task of keeping the peace

results.title: The Secrets of the Great Communicators
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Peter Thompson and Jane Lalor
results.brief_description: The ability to involve an audience, to change people’s thinking and elicit a desired response, is a skill which can be learned and in this video Peter Thompson analyses the techniques which have been used by some admired and effective communicators. Included are examples from Winston Churchill, Laurence Olivier, Bob Ansett, John Kennedy and in conclusion a lengthy extract from Martin Luther King’s “I have a dream” speech is shown.

results.title: The Secretary transcribes
results.brief_description: Begins by showing the difference between the work of a stenographer and that of a secretary. The importance of a systematic approach to work is stressed. The efficient secretary is shown at work. She keeps a card file of frequently-used addresses and knows the use of reference books. She uses a clear system in transcribing shorthand notes and checks her work while it is still in the typewriter, and is thus able to correct mistakes quickly and neatly.

results.title: The Secretary takes dictation
results.brief_description: Illustrates correct procedures and details in taking dictation. The film shows two employees, one a competent secretary and the other an inexperienced stenographer, taking dictation and contrasts the procedures used by them. The film emphasises that careful organisation, neatness and attention to details are essential in an efficient secretary.
